node.title: Investigation finds no misconduct in botched US drone strike that killed 10 Afghan civilians
node.alt: Afghans inspect car wreckage and damage of house after drone strike.
node.description: A Pentagon review finds the deadly August air strike in Kabul was caused by a series of errors, including not noticing a child minutes before the strike took place, and doesn't recommend any disciplinary action.
node.content:
["An August US drone strike in Kabul that killed 10 civilians was not caused by criminal negligence but by a series of errors, including not noticing a child minutes before the strike took place, an investigation by a military inspector general has found.", "Among the Afghan civilians killed in the August 29 strike, seven were children.\u00a0", "The\u00a0military has previously called the incident\u00a0a \"tragic mistake\".", "Initially, the Pentagon had said the strike targeted an Islamic State suicide bomber who posed an imminent threat to US-led troops at the airport as they completed the last stages of their withdrawal from Afghanistan.", "The strike came days after an Islamic State suicide bomber killed 13 US troops and scores of Afghan civilians who had crowded outside the airport gates, desperate to secure seats on evacuation flights, after US-trained Afghan forces melted away and the Taliban swept to power in the capital.", "An investigation by the air force inspector general\u00a0found there were execution errors, breakdowns in communication and in the process of identifying and confirming the target of the bombing.", "\"It's a regrettable mistake. It's an honest mistake,\" Lieutenant General Sami Said, the air force inspector general, told reporters.", "Lieutenant General\u00a0Said did not recommend disciplinary action but said it would be up to commanders to make a decision on what, if any, accountability action should be taken.", "", "
Video shows the aftermath of the strike.
", "
Video shows child\u00a0near strike site
", "He said repeated reviews of the video from that day showed that two minutes before the strike was launched, there was evidence\u00a0a child was in the strike zone.", "Lieutenant General Said, who said he watched the video himself, said troops in the strike cell did not see the child.", "\"You have to be, like, no kidding, looking for it. But when you're looking for it, certainly after the fact, if you ask me, was there evidence of the presence? Yes, there was.\"", "But he added he noticed the presence of the child as he looked at the video well after the incident and that it would have been easy to miss at the time.", "Steven Kwon, co-founder and president of Nutrition and Education International, which employed one of the victims, said the investigation was \"deeply disappointing and inadequate\".", "\"According to the inspector general, there was a mistake but no one acted wrongly, and I'm left wondering, how can that be?\" Mr Kwon said in a statement.", "\"Clearly, good military intentions are not enough when the outcome is 10 precious Afghan civilian lives lost and reputations ruined.\"", "Reuters/AP"]
